Title: Semantic Kernel SDK Tutorial – Create Smarter AI Agents
Description:
Want to develop your own AI agent using Microsoft’s Semantic Kernel SDK? In this hands-on lecture, we’ll walk through the process of building intelligent, extensible AI agents that combine reasoning, memory, and tool integration.

✅ What You’ll Learn in This Lecture:

What is Semantic Kernel SDK and why use it for AI agents
Setting up your development environment
Creating plugins, skills, and planners with Semantic Kernel
How to connect your agent to tools, APIs, and external services
Testing and deploying your AI agent in real-world workflows

▶️Watch Next : https://youtu.be/iVCH1PONcZY?si=uHtCDSa2k2mzWWiJ

Title: How Semantic Kernel Supercharges AI Agents!
Description:
🧠 Want to know how Semantic Kernel powers Agentic AI systems? In this lecture, we explore how Microsoft’s Semantic Kernel framework enables AI agents to orchestrate prompts, connect to tools, and manage memory for smarter, context-aware performance.

✅ What You’ll Learn:

What is Semantic Kernel and why it matters in Agentic AI
Core features: plugins, planners, memories, and connectors
How Semantic Kernel integrates with LLMs and Azure AI
Real-world use cases: automation, chat agents, knowledge assistants
Step-by-step guide to getting started with Semantic Kernel

By combining natural language understanding with tool integration and reasoning, Semantic Kernel allows developers to build modular, extensible, and intelligent AI agents.

💡 Perfect for AI developers, solution architects, and students looking to build production-ready AI solutions with Microsoft’s open-source agentic AI framework.

Title: Azure AI Foundry: Integrating Custom Tools into Agents
Description:
🛠 Want to make your AI agent smarter and more capable? In this lecture, we’ll show you exactly how to integrate custom tools into your AI agent using Azure AI Foundry so it can handle more complex tasks and connect to real-world data sources.

✅ What You’ll Learn:

Understanding the role of tools in AI agents
Creating and registering custom tools in Azure AI Foundry
Connecting your agent to APIs, databases, and external services
Using Prompt Flow and Model Catalog with tool integrations
Testing and validating tool functionality in your AI workflows

Whether you’re building automation bots, research assistants, or data-driven AI applications, this guide will help you extend your agent’s abilities beyond pre-trained capabilities.

💡 Perfect for AI developers, cloud engineers, and solution architects working with Microsoft Azure AI.
